entry.title: Make "Blink does not yet implement getComputedStyle..." messages less noisy.
entry.content:
Currently every developer build emits these at ERROR level whenever

developer tools is opened, listing all of the properties for which

getComputedStyle is not supported.



This isn't relevant to most Chromium developers. Downgrade this to

VERBOSE1, and while here skip the logic which isn't needed unless that

level is being logged.



Developers who are working on this can still use

--vmodule=css_computed_style_declaration=1 --enable-logging=stderr



to see these messages.



Change-Id: I59af486163ceaa72b7d9b96745ebe2a9a20b9756

entry.title: Refactor LayoutObject::ContainingScrollContainer to deal with fixed pos
entry.content:
Fixed positioned objects don't scroll with the viewport, but currently

ContainingScrollContainer() returns the LayoutView for them, which is

hard to use for anchor positioning.



This patch refactors it to make things easier. It's also a preparation

patch for https://crrev.com/c/4865596

entry.title: pip-pinch: Add resistance effect to PiP Pinch-to-Resize
entry.content:
This commit adds a new UI effect which we call the 'resistance' for

the Picture-in-Picture (PiP) Pinch-to-Resize feature. With this new

effect, when the PiP window reaches its min or max size during the

pinch, the PiP window can shrink or expand by further 15%. The PiP

window animates back to its min/max size when released.



Previously, when users attempted to expand the PiP window beyond its

maximum size using a pinch gesture, the resizing abruptly stopped with

the window size remaining at its maximum limit. Now when the window size

reaches its maximum limit, it follows a differentiable curve that

converges at 115% of the maximum size. Upon releasing the pinch gesture,

the window automatically returns to its maximum size. This behavior also

applies to when users shrink the window.



Since window bounds cannot actually be changed to one that exceeds its

limits, this commit utilizes `gfx::Transform` to visually change the

window size.



Some of the notable changes in this commit are:



1. `SetTransformDuringResize()` was added to `WindowResizer` which sets

`gfx::Transform` to the resizer's window.



2. `CalculateTransformForPinch()` was added to `PipWindowResizer` which

handles scale calculations and returns appropriate `gfx::Transform`.



3. `PipWindowResizer::CalculateBoundsForPinch()` as well as

`PipWindowResizer::CompleteDrag()` were modified to center the scale

transform around the pinch center.

entry.title: [WebGL] Eliminate WEBGL_video_texture support (reland)
entry.content:
The spec for this extension is currently marked as "Do Not Implement"

[1]. This CL removes its implementation from Chromium and instead makes

the extension unsupported in Chromium. The concrete motivation for doing

this now (in addition to code cleanup) is that enables removing a usage

of legacy mailboxes in PaintCanvasVideoRenderer (done in this CL).



NOTE: This CL is a reland. The test failure on Mac/NVIDIA that

necessitated a revert has been suppressed in the interim per [2].



[1] https://registry.khronos.org/webgl/extensions/proposals/WEBGL_video_texture/

[2] https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1488444#c4



Bug: 1410164

entry.title: [ios] Handle batch operation in SceneController
entry.content:
Check whether the changes on a WebStateList are part of a batch

operation, and, if they are, delay the decision until the end of

the batch. This will ensure that the the optimisation in the `DeserializeWebStateList()` function to close the NTP does not

result in the SceneController opening the tab grid view.

entry.title: Expose APIs that are cross-origin-isolated with --disable-web-security
entry.content:
--disable-web-security is used to disable cross-origin isolation in

general. Various things like certain bindings (e.g.

performance.measureUserAgentSpecificMemory()) are gated behind the

WebIDL attribute 'CrossOriginIsolated'. This mostly depends on

Agent::CrossOriginIsolated(). Set this property directly on the renderer

process when --disable-web-security is provided.



The effect is that various otherwise gated APIs become usable which is

useful for debugging.



Bug: chromium:1486857

entry.title: VDPipeline: Set decoder task runner to media service one with OOPVD
entry.content:
VideoDecoderPipeline allocates a decoder thread for each decoder.

In out-of-process video decoding, the video decoder running in GPU

process delegates the call to video decoder process through mojo

invocation. Since its processing is cheap, it must be harmless to set

the video decoder task runner to the media service task runner. It

would avoid the thread context switch and cpu scheduling thus decode

time is reduced. The decode time is reduced from 2.50ms to 2.25 ms in

webrtc.RTCPeerConnectionPerf.h264_720p_hw_enc_hw_oopvd.

Ideally, we should remove PostTask() code, but this CL doesn't do it

for simplicity. It needs to take into account the VideoDecoder

callback order.



Bug: b:292870413

Test: webrtc.RTCPeerConnectionPerf.h264_720p_hw_enc_hw_oopvd

entry.title: Floss: Initiate clients after interface is present
entry.content:
Currently we register client callbacks when the default adapter is

enabled. This is fine in the current Floss design since Floss exposes

all interfaces as soon as the daemon is up. But in this design of Floss,

clients can poke some interface too early before ths internal stack

state isn't ready.



Floss will change its design to only export the DBus interface after it

is ready. This CL changes chrome's behavior to match Floss's change.

entry.title: Make `BaseCondition` movable in SW router evaluator implementations
entry.content:
This CL replaces absl::optional to std::unique_ptr to make the class

movable.

We plan to create a vector of `BaseCondition` to implement the `or`

conditional syntax on SW Static Routing API. However, we cannot do it

because `BaseCondition` is immovable since it has `std::optional`

in its members and `RE2` is not movable.

According to the RE2 document, I think the best way is migrating to

std::unique_ptr, per https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/re2/src/re2/re2.h;l=291



Design Doc: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1B2D8w_2M4j9CZC1VccBOAhfCdiRP3yPCSV5UKKDhU70/



Explainer: https://github.com/WICG/service-worker-static-routing-api/blob/main/final-form.md

Change-Id: If91badde0febcd62d370443fcbd746ae3ca714ae

entry.title: [Discounts] Add fuzzy matching for URL with Quest UTM tag
entry.content:
For navigations originated from clicking a Quest tile with discount,

we'll append special UTM tags to identify them. For these navigations,

we'll try the best to show discounts to avoid confusing the users and

introducing inconsistent UI behavior.



However, we noticed three scenarios where the navigations from Discount

in Quest doesn't show discount chip in omnibox, they are caused by: (1)

Backend flakiness. (2) Merchant removes discount before it expires. (3)

Backend no longer able to identify product with UTM tags added.



To deal with issue, this CL adds a fuzzy matching mechanism only for

the navigations from clicking Discount in Quest (i.e. with the special

UTM). When a URL contains special UTM tags but doesn't have discount

from server, we try to find discount for this URL in storage by

removing the UTM tags and carrying out a fuzzy matching.



Bug: 1488624

Change-Id: I69a50d3f4934e6e408bcdbe32d732fcb6afcd2bb

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4908404

Commit-Queue: Yue Zhang

Reviewed-by: Matthew Jones

entry.title: snap-group: Reland Correct drop target bounds for the `OverviewGroupItem`
entry.content:
This is a reland of crrev.com/c/4906318



This original cl was reverted as the `inset` was not initialized

in `GetTopViewInset()` of `overview_grid.cc`.



The bounds for the drop target should match the item which the drop

target is a placeholder for. It should also be applicable for group

item. This cl does the following things to make it work:

1. Update the logic in

`OverviewGrid::CalculateWidthAndMaybeSetUnclippedBounds()` where

the width for the drop target widget is calculated;

2. Update `IsDropTargetWindow()` to `IsDropTargetItem()` in order to

take the overview group item into account;

3. Update the insets value in `OverviewGroupItem` anonymous space, to

only have insets in the middle.



Fixed: b/301490403, 1489085

Demo: http://b/301490403#comment2

Test: Added unit tests + manual

Change-Id: I2e43a123d8c9cbd73a2df64e9eb717d69b6a3fce

entry.title: content/utility: Run StableVideoDecoderService on IO thread
entry.content:
StableVideoDecoderService runs in Video decoder process main thread.

Since a mojo message wakes the IO thread of the process and then the

thread wakes the main thread to receive the mojo message. Since the

process performs mojo invocation for video decoders, the wake up of

IO thread is unnecessary. This CL lets the StableVideoDecoderService

run on the IO thread.



Bug: b:297304712, b:301014328

entry.title: Revert "[autopip] Show autopip UI for video pip"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 5dc94621f13c2dcad7a8eaca01e3728b2714c4b5.



Reason for revert:



Builder: linux-chromeos-dbg

https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg

https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/linux-chromeos-dbg/b8768256535210477921

History: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Abrowser_tests%2FAutoPictureInPictureTabHelperBrowserTest.ImmediatelyClosesAutopipIfTabIsAlreadyFocused





Original change's description:

> [autopip] Show autopip UI for video pip

>

> Because video pip tries to show the overlay view before pip setup is

> complete, the auto pip tab helpber believed (correctly) that there is

> no auto-pip open. As a result, the setting overlay ui was skipped.

entry.title: [Win] Ensure the file picker gets closed when its owner window is closed
entry.content:
This change is a fix to a UX issue that can happen in rare

circumstances where the owner of the file picker dialog can be

closed while the dialog itself stays open.



In normal operation, this doesn't happen because the owner window

is disabled. While disabled, the user can't click anything on the

window, including the X button on the top right.



But programmatically, it is possible. For example, another program

can send WM_CLOSE to the owner window, leaving the dialog open.



With this change, we detect such situations and close the dialog.



Change-Id: Ibd692f59b2b000b4706de5677a89d0ed00923595

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4873762

Commit-Queue: Patrick Monette

Reviewed-by: Scott Violet

Reviewed-by: Sorin Jianu

entry.title: Revert "snap-group: Correct drop target bounds for the `OverviewGroupItem`"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 08e77e6044d8dc70f8080e45857c435686bb49be.



Reason for revert: Builder: Linux ChromiumOS MSan Tests

https://ci.chromium.org/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests

First failing build:

https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20ChromiumOS%20MSan%20Tests/38777/overview



Sample stack trace:



==235916==WARNING: MemorySanitizer: use-of-uninitialized-value

#0 0x56206b82114e in ash::OverviewGrid::FitWindowRectsInBounds() ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_grid.cc:2609:9

#1 0x56206b803b04 in ash::OverviewGrid::GetWindowRects() ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_grid.cc:2441:24

#2 0x56206b806fce in ash::OverviewGrid::PositionWindows() ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_grid.cc:689:13

#3 0x56206b80c92a in ash::OverviewGrid::AddItem() ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_grid.cc:835:5

#4 0x56206b865c27 in ash::OverviewSession::AddItem() ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_session.cc:565:9

#5 0x56206b80fb65 in ash::OverviewGrid::AddDropTargetForDraggingFromThisGrid(ash::OverviewItemBase*) ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_grid.cc:949:22

#6 0x56206b8817d0 in ash::OverviewWindowDragController::StartNormalDragMode(gfx::PointF const&) ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_window_drag_controller.cc:352:18

#7 0x56206b8811a3 in ash::OverviewWindowDragController::Drag(gfx::PointF const&) ./../../ash/wm/overview/overview_window_drag_controller.cc:281:7



Original change's description:

> snap-group: Correct drop target bounds for the `OverviewGroupItem`

>

> The bounds for the drop target should match the item which the drop

> target is a placeholder for. It should also be applicable for group

> item. This cl does the following things to make it work:

> 1. Update the logic in

> `OverviewGrid::CalculateWidthAndMaybeSetUnclippedBounds()` where

> the width for the drop target widget is calculated;

> 2. Update `IsDropTargetWindow()` to `IsDropTargetItem()` in order to

> take the overview group item into account;

> 3. Update the insets value in `OverviewGroupItem` anonymous space, to

> only have insets in the middle.

>

> Fixed: b/301490403

> Demo: http://b/301490403#comment2

> Test: Added unit tests + manual

> Change-Id: I67e84bdf795833e9b92bbca39098013485953dd7

entry.title: snap-group: Do not allow snapping an `OverviewGroupItem`
entry.content:
This cl implements the logic to disallow snapping an `OverviewGroupItem`

in overview when two `OverviewItem`s are hosted by it.

However, if one of the windows gets destroyed, the remaining

`OverviewItem` will become snappable.

Test: Added unit test + manual

entry.title: Modernize chrome://system UI implementation.
entry.content:
- Use web components and Polymer

- Leverage dom-repeat and Polymer data bindings to render the UI

- Use the BrowserProxy pattern, paving the way for adding tests

- Simplify spinner logic (use throbber_small.svg instead of custom CSS

animation).



This is mostly a complete rewrite with the exception of porting over

some old styles, and the logic for parsing external log files.



Also, c/b/r/about_sys/about_sys.css was previously shared between

chrome://system and chrome://feedback, and is now moved to

c/b/r/feedback/ since it is only used there.

external/wpt/mathml/presentation-markup/operators/operator-dictionary-spacing-005.html

entry.title: arc-a11y: Fix serialization invalidation of merged text node
entry.content:
In AXTreeSourceAndroid, on every accessibility event we currently

invalidate a subtree under an event source and serialize changes.



When a text in some node changes, Android a11y framework sends a text

changed event from the changed node.

Also, AXTreeSourceAndroid has a logic to compute an accessibility name

from descendants.

Thus, before this change, when a name of a node that is used by

ancestor's name computation changes, the parent node is not invalidated

and the updated name is not sent to chrome automation.



This fixes the above issue by finding the first focusable ancestor of

the source node and use it as a root of invalidation.



Bug: b:302067175

Test: AXTreeSourceAndroidTest

Test: talkback test app "Contest change" screen

Change-Id: Ifed31d11b2c4c839a86bf476efd44cfc759df1c2

entry.title: fix the crash of pagination view
entry.content:
This cl fixed the crash caused by performing fling gesture on quick

settings media view when there is only one media item.



When there is no media item, pagination view has no selector dot.

However, fling gesture would still trigger a transition change which

may start a selector dot animation. To fix it, we should not perform

selector dot animation in PaginationView::TransitionChanged if the

selector dot does not exist.



Test with unit test and manually test.



Test: QuickSettingsMediaViewTest.NoCrashOnScrollFlingStart

entry.content:
This is a reland of commit d131b3b4f9e080ec8133f4f502efb95b529fff98



The original change got reverted because it caused the test failures:

Original change's description:

> Changed the mute toggle behavior for volume down key/BT devices

>

> buttons on the device will only change the volume level but not the

entry.title: serial: Let Windows permission objects omit kDeviceInstanceIdKey
entry.content:
SerialChooserContext creates a base::Value::Dict to represent serial

device permissions. On Windows the device instance ID is used to

identify the device and is stored under the key kDeviceInstanceIdKey.



Prior to crrev.com/c/4609200 all valid serial permission objects

on Windows contained kDeviceInstanceIdKey. The CL added support for

Bluetooth RFCOMM serial ports which are identified by the device path,

stored under kBluetoothDevicePathKey.



SerialChooserContext::HasPortPermission still assumes all valid

permission objects contain kDeviceInstanceIdKey and dereference it

without a null-check. This CL checks for nullptr before dereferencing.

entry.title: Let LayoutObject::InvalidateIntersectionObserverCachedRects() schedule update
entry.content:
Previously all callers of

LayoutObject::InvalidateIntersectionObserverCachedRects() called

LocalFrameView::SetIntersectionObservationState() immediately.

Now let the former call the latter to ensure intersection observation

update will be always scheduled when any cached rects are invalidated.



This is a pure refactor without any behavior change.

entry.title: [OOPIF PDF] Use the embedder frame's source SiteInstance for navigating
entry.content:
Instead of using the WebContents's SiteInstance for the

NavigationHandle, use the parent frame's SiteInstance instead.



The parent frame should always be the embedder frame for this

navigation. For the PDF viewer, the embedder frame is the PDF extension

frame.



GuestView PDF viewer and Print Preview use two WebContentses, and the

inner WebContents's SiteInstance and the embedder frame's SiteInstance

are the same. However, for OOPIF PDF viewer, which only has one

WebContents, they are different, and must be the embedder frame's.



Also, rather than using a WebContents WeakPtr for the navigation task,

use the embedder frame's global ID instead, and retrieve the frame host

and WebContents using the ID. The global ID is already needed to get the

correct SiteInstance.

entry.title: [Office upload] Pass CloudOpenMetrics through the entire Clippy flow
entry.content:
Introduce new object CloudOpenMetrics which is created at the start of

the cloud upload/open flow, passed through the flow and destroyed at the

end.



Memory management of CloudOpenMetrics:

- Created and accessed as a unique_ptr at the start of the flow in

ExecuteFileTask().

- `std::move`d through the flow until it reaches CloudOpenTask where

CloudOpenTask is the permanent owner.

- Passed as a SafeRef to DriveUploadHandler or OneDriveUploadHandler

if upload is required.

- CloudOpenTask (and CloudOpenMetrics) always outlives the upload

handler.



Testing of CloudOpenMetrics:

- Check that CloudOpenMetrics is destroyed in tests that

- have to create a unique_ptr of CloudOpenMetrics.

- and get to a cloud upload/open flow end-point.

- In cases where CloudOpenTask is created in the scope of the test, it

may be necessary to add a scope around the test before doing the above

check.

entry.title: viz: Allow render passes with protected content to merge even with COR
entry.content:
This change makes it so we force merging render passes with protected

content that were originally denied merging dur to a copy output

request. We do this by copying the render pass with the COR and merging

its quads into the dest pass. We do this so that e.g. protected videos

can play even if someone is tried to share a tab containing them. Note

that the capture will still not include the video content-- this change

just allows the video to play on the local screen in this case. This

also only works with the case where a user is capturing a non-root

render pass (a separate follow-up change is needed to support a copy

request on the root pass).



In the case handled by this change, we will be drawing the captured

render pass twice-- once to an intermediate surface for the copy output

request and again to the root pass for screen display.



To handle cases where the copy request is on the root pass, we need

crrev.com/c/4575493. To handle cases with video capture, we need

crrev.com/c/4888982.

entry.title: Drag and drop: prevent cross-origin same-tab drags that span navigations
entry.content:
In IsValidDragTarget, the old RenderViewHostID comparison was not

necessary to distinguish between same- and different-tab drags because,

contrary to the previous comment, that case is covered by the

`drag_start_` check. This check was only serving to permit some drags

which were same-tab, but not same-RVH, which should be disallowed.



A complete rundown of the business logic and the reason for the

business logic is here:

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1266953#c22



A regression test is added which is confirmed to fail without this fix,

but only on Chrome OS because that's the only Aura platform where the

DND interactive UI tests are not already disabled (Windows and Linux

were disabled).



Bug: 1485266
